subject: Send push-style event only if EventService enabled
commitMessage:
Send push-style event only if EventService enabled

As per DMTF Redfish, if the event service is disabled, events are not
expected to be posted to the existing subscribers

This commit adds validation to check "ServiceEnabled" property while
sending events. An additional check is made not to attempt sending
events if there are no event subscribers at BMC

Tested by:
Using DMTF Redfish-Event-Listener script with some local modification
to support the latest event subscription specifications

 1. With a Push-style event subscriber setup, set "ServiceEnabled" to
    false
    PATCH /redfish/v1/EventService -d '{"ServiceEnabled":false}'
 2. Generate events and check no events are posted to subscriber
 2. Set "ServiceEnabled" to true. BMC should resume sending further
    events
 3. Check if BMC attempts to send events by forming the eventRecords
    when there are no subscriptions made - Verified with traces that
    events are not sent out
 4. With "ServiceEnabled" set to false, verified the SubmitTestEvent
    fails

Signed-off-by: Sunitha Harish <sunharis@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: Icbe7c25ba12bbfb73e59639c484fccdf384ebecf

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 6ba8c82ef6e67486b251cdc8c75e5a65a419a0ab
Considering we have no tooling to check event service, can you post your tooling/server you used to check this behavior?

I used DMTF Redfish-Event-Listener script https://github.com/DMTF/Redfish-Event-Listener
This script is considerably old, needed local modifications to support the new Event schema.
If that's your testing tool of choice, can you open up patches against the event listener that make it work with this change?
Sure Ed. I can do that, but may not be immediately due to other planned priority items.
Please follow up on this so other people can test this feature as well.

Thanks for this commit. Can you use your full name here?

From https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/09d1bd495a983058ea057597d1ef8bd1f4022d50/CONTRIBUTING.md#formatting-commit-messages

All commit messages must include a "Signed-off-by" line, which indicates that you the contributor have agreed to the Developer Certificate of Origin (see below). This line must include the full name you commonly use, often a given name and a family name or surname. (ok: Sam Samuelsson, Robert A. Heinlein; not ok: xXthorXx, Sam, RAH)
Some gerrit setup has messed up my name here. Figuring it out. I will update it soon. Thank you
Can you please mention how this is done - is this through the config file in event listener/any command?

what is the result of this test case?
it should not send events right?

does this enable values persists across boot?
no subscriptions accepted when service disabled?

> does this enable values persists across boot?
Yes. https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/40211
> no subscriptions accepted when service disabled?
This is under discussion at https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/44644

This would also block /redfish/v1/EventService/Actions/EventService.SubmitTestEvent/ correct? 
Which I think makes sense.

Although sure seems like in that case, /redfish/v1/EventService/Actions/EventService.SubmitTestEvent/ a message back would be more helpful to the client. 
I don't see anything obvious in https://redfish.dmtf.org/registries/Base.1.10.0.json 
A "ActionNotSuportedAtThisTime" "ActionDisabled" "ActionEnablePropertyConflictError"

My pick would be:
"ActionDisabled" - Action disabled due to %1

That's a really good point.  If we're rejecting a message, we should have a return code on this method.  The normal flow will ignore it, but we should probably give back at the very least the right error code for the test event case.

Agree. @Gunnar - can you please help getting this Base Message Registry type for this scenario via DMTF?
I can implement that registry once we have that in the schema as a separate commit.

Should we wait for the DMTF to add it to the schema and then take this commit in ?

> Agree. @Gunnar - can you please help getting this Base Message Registry type for this scenario via DMTF?
> I can implement that registry once we have that in the schema as a separate commit.
> 
> Should we wait for the DMTF to add it to the schema and then take this commit in ?

I'm ok with merging a sub-optimal message here, then updating if/when we get a better DMTF message, but there needs to be SOME message and an appropriate return code on the SendTestEvent action (also, that should be tested).
Ok. I will push a new patchset with the possible handling of return code at SendTestEvent

>  can you please help getting this Base Message Registry type for this scenario via DMTF?

4774 is the issue

Redfish said use "ServiceDisabled" in this case. More discussion on issue 4774. 

"ServiceDisabled" is in the registry now and has been for a while.

Sure Gunnar. But this is not yet out under https://redfish.dmtf.org/registries

requests.exceptions.HTTPError: 404 Client Error: Not Found for url: https://redfish.dmtf.org/registries/Base.1.11.0.json

This variable is at line#96 of this file. That's when this attribute gets PATCH request
Line 96 as a variable that's similar in name and type, but exists in a totally different scope.  In this scope, this variable doesn't look used.
This code duplicates a check already present in EventService.  Just have sendEvent return an error code if the service is disabled.
To get the value of service enabled/not, I should do a fresh fetch for it via getEventServiceConfig
Ideally, we shoul dhave return codes on the sendTestEventLog() that indicate that there were no subscribers, or the service was disabled, so we can return the right message.

Those specific message registries are not available. Gunnar has an issue created at DMTF, once that is available, this change can be done.

Added code to check for the number of subscription
How about using "PreconditionRequired" until a more specific error message is included?

To be more concrete.  This should be returning a return code.
This comment seems to have been ignored in the latest patch.
Done. Returning boolean from sendEvent at #394 since that method is used at sendTestEventLog
This should return Service disabled or something of that nature.
To repeat.... this duplicates the logic on line 1014.  Simply return the correct state with a return code.
This logic is still duplicated, which was commented earlier.
My bad to miss this point. Done.

This is the wrong message when no subscribers are set up.  I suspect this needs to:
A. Ignore if there are no subscribers and accept the request anyway.
B. Send a better error message if no subscribers are subscribed.

ServiceDisabled should only be returned the the service is disabled.
Ed, Not sure why there are CI failures for the files which are not changed in this commit !
Solved. Rebased to the latest master
